abstract.text: Entry point of the Apphud SDK. It provides access to all its features.
Basically the same as restoring purchases.
Returns current userID that identifies user across his multiple devices.
Returns an array of all subscriptions that this user has ever purchased. Subscriptions are cached on device.
Returns
if user has active subscription.
Rule with a screen that was delayed for presentation.
Screen view controller that is pending for presentation. This is the screen that is triggered by your pending Rule. You can use
method or present this controller manually.
Permission groups configured in Apphud dashboard > Product Hub > Products. Groups are cached on device.
Refreshes
s from the App Store. You have to add all product identifiers in Apphud Dashboard > Product Hub > Products.
Returns base64 encoded App Store receipt string, if available.
Returns current device ID. You should use it only if you want to implement custom logout/login flow by saving User ID & Device ID pair for each app user.
Fetches raw receipt info in a wrapped
model class. This might be useful to get
value.
Enables debug logs. You should call this method before SDK initialization.
Displays an offer code redemption sheet.
Returns
if current build is running on sumulator or Debug/TestFlight modes. Returns
if current build is App Store build.
Apphud is all-in-one infrastructure for your app growth. Apphud helps marketing and product management teams to make right decisions based on the data and tools.
Returns array of
objects that you added in Apphud > Product Hub > Products.
Submit Advertising Identifier (IDFA) to Apphud. This is used to properly match user with attribution platforms (AppsFlyer, Facebook, etc.)
This notification is sent when
s are fetched from the App Store. Note that you have to add all product identifiers in Apphud Dashboard > Product Hub > Products.
Logs out current user, clears all saved data and resets SDK to uninitialized state. You will need to call
or
again to initilize SDK with a new user.
Checks promotional offers eligibility for multiple products at once.
Presents Apphud screen that was delayed for presentation, i.e.
was returned in
delegate method.
. Fetches paywalls configured in Apphud dashboard. This makes an API request to Apphud. Always check if there are cached paywalls on device by using paywalls method.
Returns
object by product identifier. Note that you have to add this product identifier in Apphud Dashboard > Product Hub > Products.
Checks introductory offers eligibility for multiple products at once.
Submit device push token to Apphud.
Initializes Apphud SDK with User ID & Device ID pair. Not recommended for use unless you know what you are doing.
Returns subscription object that current user has ever purchased. Subscriptions are cached on device.
Purchases subscription (promotional) offer and automatically submits App Store Receipt to Apphud.
Set a delegate.
Deprecated. Purchase product by product identifier. Use this method if you don’t use Apphud Paywalls logic.
Updates user ID value.
Increment custom user property. Value must be one of:
or
Entry point of the Apphud SDK. It provides access to all its features.
Returns
if current user has purchased standard in-app purchase with given product identifier. Returns
if this product is refunded or never purchased. Includes consumables, nonconsumables or non-renewing subscriptions. Apphud only tracks consumables if they were purchased after integrating Apphud SDK.

Purchases product and automatically submits App Store Receipt to Apphud. This method doesn’t wait until Apphud validates receipt from Apple and immediately returns transaction object. This method may be useful if you don’t care about receipt validation in callback.
Set a UI delegate.
